content: 1 In the first year of Cyrus､ king of Persia, to fulfil the word of Yahweh from the mouth of Jeremiah Yahweh aroused the spirit of Cyrus､ king of Persia, and he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom､ moreover also in writing､ saying:
content_old: 1 In the first year of Cyrus､ king of Persia, to fulfil the word of Yahweh from the mouth of Jeremiah Yahweh aroused the spirit of Cyrus､ king of Persia, and he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom､ moreover also in writing､ saying:

content: 2 Thus saith Cyrus､ king of Persia, All the kingdoms of the earth hath Yahweh God of the heavens given to me,—and he himself hath laid charge upon me､ to build for him a house, in Jerusalem､ which is in Judah.
content_old: 2 Thus saith Cyrus､ king of Persia, All the kingdoms of the earth hath Yahweh God of the heavens given to me,—and he himself hath laid charge upon me､ to build for him a house, in Jerusalem､ which is in Judah.

content: 3 Who is there among you of all his people? His God be with him, and let him go up to Jerusalem､ which is in Judah,—and build the house of Yahweh God of Israel, (he is God!) which is in Jerusalem;
content_old: 3 Who is there among you of all his people? His God be with him, and let him go up to Jerusalem､ which is in Judah,—and build the house of Yahweh God of Israel, (he is God!) which is in Jerusalem;

content: 4 And whosoever is left､ of all the places where he doth sojourn let the men of his place uphold him, with silver and with gold､ and with goods and with beasts,—along with a voluntary offering for the house of God､ which is in Jerusalem.
content_old: 4 And whosoever is left､ of all the places where he doth sojourn let the men of his place uphold him, with silver and with gold､ and with goods and with beasts,—along with a voluntary offering for the house of God､ which is in Jerusalem.

content: 5 Then arose the ancestral chiefs of Judah and Benjamin, and the priests､ and the Levites,—even every one whose spirit God had aroused, to go up to build the house of Yahweh､ which was in Jerusalem;
content_old: 5 Then arose the ancestral chiefs of Judah and Benjamin, and the priests､ and the Levites,—even every one whose spirit God had aroused, to go up to build the house of Yahweh､ which was in Jerusalem;

content: 6 and all they who were round about them strengthened their hands, with utensils of silver､ with gold､ with goods and with beasts､ and with precious things,—besides any thing he had volunteered.
content_old: 6 and all they who were round about them strengthened their hands, with utensils of silver､ with gold､ with goods and with beasts､ and with precious things,—besides any thing he had volunteered.

content: 7 And King Cyrus brought forth the utensils of the house of Yahweh,—which Nebuchadnezzar had brought forth from Jerusalem, and put in the house of his gods:—
content_old: 7 And King Cyrus brought forth the utensils of the house of Yahweh,—which Nebuchadnezzar had brought forth from Jerusalem, and put in the house of his gods:—

content: 8 yea Cyrus king of Persia brought them forth, by the hand of Mithredath the treasurer,—and numbered them unto Sheshbazzar, a leader of Judah.
content_old: 8 yea Cyrus king of Persia brought them forth, by the hand of Mithredath the treasurer,—and numbered them unto Sheshbazzar, a leader of Judah.

content: 9 And these were the numbers of them,—basins of gold thirty､ basins of silver a thousand, knives twenty-nine;
content_old: 9 And these were the numbers of them,—basins of gold thirty､ basins of silver a thousand, knives twenty-nine;

content: 10 bowls of gold thirty, bowla of silver､ of a secondary sort four hundred and ten,—other utensils a thousand.
content_old: 10 bowls of gold thirty, bowla of silver､ of a secondary sort four hundred and ten,—other utensils a thousand.

content: 61 And of the sons of the priests the sons of Habaiah､ the sons of Hakkoz,—the sons of Barzillai､ who took of the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite to wife, and was called after their name.

content: 62 These sought their writing wherein they were registered､ but they were not found,—so they were desecrated out of the priesthood;
content_old: 62 These sought their writing wherein they were registered､ but they were not found,—so they were desecrated out of the priesthood;

content: 63 and the governor told them, that they must not eat of the most holy things,—until there should stand up a priest､ with Lights and Perfections.

content_old: 66 their horses were seven hundred and thirty-six,—their mules two hundred and forty-five;

content: 68 And a portion of the ancestral chiefs when they came to the house of Yahweh which was in Jerusalem offered voluntarily for the house of God, to set it up on its basis.

content: 69 According to their ability gave they unto the treasury of the work, of gold sixty-one thousand drams, and of silver five thousand manehs,—and tunics for priests one hundred.
content_old: 69 According to their ability gave they unto the treasury of the work, of gold sixty-one thousand drams, and of silver five thousand manehs,—and tunics for priests one hundred.

content: 1 But when the seventh month was come, and the sons of Israel were in cities then did the people gather themselves together as one man､ unto Jerusalem.
content_old: 1 But when the seventh month was come, and the sons of Israel were in cities then did the people gather themselves together as one man､ unto Jerusalem.

content: 2 Then arose—Jeshua son of Jozadak and his brethren the priests､ and Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel and his brethren, and built the altar of the God of Israel,—to offer thereon ascending-sacrifices, as it was written in the law of Moses､ the man of God.
content_old: 2 Then arose—Jeshua son of Jozadak and his brethren the priests､ and Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel and his brethren, and built the altar of the God of Israel,—to offer thereon ascending-sacrifices, as it was written in the law of Moses､ the man of God.

content: 3 So they settled the altar upon its stands, for dread was upon them､ because of the peoples of the countries,—therefore caused they to go up thereon､ ascending-sacrifices unto Yahweh, ascending-sacrifices for the morning and for the evening.
content_old: 3 So they settled the altar upon its stands, for dread was upon them､ because of the peoples of the countries,—therefore caused they to go up thereon､ ascending-sacrifices unto Yahweh, ascending-sacrifices for the morning and for the evening.

content: 4 And they kept the festival of booths､ as it was written,—and the ascending-offering of each day upon its own day､ by number, according to regulation､ the matter of a day upon its day;
content_old: 4 And they kept the festival of booths､ as it was written,—and the ascending-offering of each day upon its own day､ by number, according to regulation､ the matter of a day upon its day;

content: 5 and after-wards the continual ascending-sacrifice､ and on the new moons, and on all the appointed seasons of Yahweh the hallowed things,—also for every one that volunteered a voluntary offering unto Yahweh.
content_old: 5 and after-wards the continual ascending-sacrifice､ and on the new moons, and on all the appointed seasons of Yahweh the hallowed things,—also for every one that volunteered a voluntary offering unto Yahweh.

content: 6 From the first day of the seventh month began they to offer up ascending-sacrifices unto Yahweh,—but the temple of Yahweh had not had its foundation laid.
content_old: 6 From the first day of the seventh month began they to offer up ascending-sacrifices unto Yahweh,—but the temple of Yahweh had not had its foundation laid.

content: 7 And they gave silver, unto the masons and carpenters,—and food and drink and oil､ unto them of Zidon and unto them of Tyre, to bring in cedar-trees out of the Lebanon､ unto the sea of Joppa, according to the grant of Cyrus king of Persia unto them.
content_old: 7 And they gave silver, unto the masons and carpenters,—and food and drink and oil､ unto them of Zidon and unto them of Tyre, to bring in cedar-trees out of the Lebanon､ unto the sea of Joppa, according to the grant of Cyrus king of Persia unto them.

content: 8 Now in the second year of their coming in unto the house of God､ to Jerusalem, in the second month began Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel and Jeshua son of Jozadak and the rest of their brethren—the priests and the Levites､ and all that were come out of the captivity to Jerusalem, and stationed the Levites､ of twenty years old and upwards, to preside over the work of the house of Yahweh.
content_old: 8 Now in the second year of their coming in unto the house of God､ to Jerusalem, in the second month began Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel and Jeshua son of Jozadak and the rest of their brethren—the priests and the Levites､ and all that were come out of the captivity to Jerusalem, and stationed the Levites､ of twenty years old and upwards, to preside over the work of the house of Yahweh.

content: 9 So they took their station—even Jeshua､ his sons and his brethren, Kadmiel and his sons､ sons of Judah, as one man to preside over the doer of the work in the house of God, the sons of Henadad, their sons and their brethren､ the Levites.
content_old: 9 So they took their station—even Jeshua､ his sons and his brethren, Kadmiel and his sons､ sons of Judah, as one man to preside over the doer of the work in the house of God, the sons of Henadad, their sons and their brethren､ the Levites.

content: 10 And when the builders laid the foundation of the temple of Yahweh then the priests､ enrobed､ took their stand with trumpets､ and the Levites the sons of Asaph with cymbals, to offer praise unto Yahweh､ after the instructions of David king of Israel.
content_old: 10 And when the builders laid the foundation of the temple of Yahweh then the priests､ enrobed､ took their stand with trumpets､ and the Levites the sons of Asaph with cymbals, to offer praise unto Yahweh､ after the instructions of David king of Israel.

content: 11 And when they made responses in offering praise and in giving thanks unto Yahweh— For he is good, For age-abiding is his lovingkindness､ upon Israel then all the people shouted with a great shout､ in offering praise unto Yahweh, over the laying of the foundation of the house of Yahweh.
content_old: 11 And when they made responses in offering praise and in giving thanks unto Yahweh— For he is good, For age-abiding is his lovingkindness､ upon Israel then all the people shouted with a great shout､ in offering praise unto Yahweh, over the laying of the foundation of the house of Yahweh.

content: 12 But many of the priests and the Levites and the ancestral chiefs､ who were old men､ that had seen the first house when the foundation of this house was laid before their eyes were weeping with a loud voice,—many however､ shouting and rejoicing､ with voice raised on high;
content_old: 12 But many of the priests and the Levites and the ancestral chiefs､ who were old men､ that had seen the first house when the foundation of this house was laid before their eyes were weeping with a loud voice,—many however､ shouting and rejoicing､ with voice raised on high;

content: 1 Now when the adversaries of Judah and Benjamin heard—that the Sons of the Exile were building the temple, unto Yahweh､ God of Israel
content_old: 1 Now when the adversaries of Judah and Benjamin heard—that the Sons of the Exile were building the temple, unto Yahweh､ God of Israel

content: 2 then drew they near unto Zerubbabel､ and unto the ancestral chiefs､ and said unto them､ Let us build with you, for like you we seek your God, and unto him have we been sacrificing since the days of Esar-haddon､ king of Assyria, who brought us up hither.
content_old: 2 then drew they near unto Zerubbabel､ and unto the ancestral chiefs､ and said unto them､ Let us build with you, for like you we seek your God, and unto him have we been sacrificing since the days of Esar-haddon､ king of Assyria, who brought us up hither.

content: 3 But Zerubbabel and Jeshua and the rest of the ancestral chiefs of Israel､ said unto them, It pertaineth not to you and to us in common to build a house unto our God,—but we ourselves together will build unto Yahweh､ God of Israel, even as King Cyrus､ king of Persia､ hath commanded us.
content_old: 3 But Zerubbabel and Jeshua and the rest of the ancestral chiefs of Israel､ said unto them, It pertaineth not to you and to us in common to build a house unto our God,—but we ourselves together will build unto Yahweh､ God of Israel, even as King Cyrus､ king of Persia､ hath commanded us.

content: 4 Then came it to pass､ that the people of the land were weakening the hands of the people of. Judah,—and troubling them in building;
content_old: 4 Then came it to pass､ that the people of the land were weakening the hands of the people of. Judah,—and troubling them in building;

content: 5 and hiring against them counsellors､ to overturn their purpose,—all the days of Cyrus､ king of Persia, even until the reign of Darius､ king of Persia.
content_old: 5 and hiring against them counsellors､ to overturn their purpose,—all the days of Cyrus､ king of Persia, even until the reign of Darius､ king of Persia.

content: 6 And in the reign of Ahasuerus, in the beginning of his reign wrote they an accusation, against the inhabitants of Judah and Jerusalem.
content_old: 6 And in the reign of Ahasuerus, in the beginning of his reign wrote they an accusation, against the inhabitants of Judah and Jerusalem.

content: 7 And in the days of Artaxerxes wrote Bishlam､ Mithredath､ Tabeel､ and the rest of his associates､ unto Artaxerxes､ king of Persia,—and the writing of the letter was written in Aramean､ and was to be interpreted as Aramean.
content_old: 7 And in the days of Artaxerxes wrote Bishlam､ Mithredath､ Tabeel､ and the rest of his associates､ unto Artaxerxes､ king of Persia,—and the writing of the letter was written in Aramean､ and was to be interpreted as Aramean.

content: 8 Rehum holder of judicial authority､ and Shimshai the scribe wrote a certain letter against Jerusalem,—to Artaxerxes the king､ thus:
content_old: 8 Rehum holder of judicial authority､ and Shimshai the scribe wrote a certain letter against Jerusalem,—to Artaxerxes the king､ thus:

content: 9 Then Rehum holder of judicial authority､ and Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their associates,—the Dinaites and the Apharsathchites､ the Tarpelites､ the Apharsites､ the Archevites､ the Babylonians､ the Shushanchites, the Dehaites､ the Elamites;
content_old: 9 Then Rehum holder of judicial authority､ and Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their associates,—the Dinaites and the Apharsathchites､ the Tarpelites､ the Apharsites､ the Archevites､ the Babylonians､ the Shushanchites, the Dehaites､ the Elamites;

content: 10 and the rest of the peoples､ whom the great and noble Osnappar hath exiled, and set in the city of Samaria,—and the rest Beyond the River､ and so forth:
content_old: 10 and the rest of the peoples､ whom the great and noble Osnappar hath exiled, and set in the city of Samaria,—and the rest Beyond the River､ and so forth:

content: 11 This is a copy of the letter which they sent unto him—unto Artaxerxes the king,— Thy servants､ the men Beyond the River and so forth:
content_old: 11 This is a copy of the letter which they sent unto him—unto Artaxerxes the king,— Thy servants､ the men Beyond the River and so forth:

content: 12 Be it known unto the king,—that the Jews who came up from thee unto us are come to Jerusalem,—the rebellious and wicked city are they building, and the walls have they finished, and the foundations will they repair.
content_old: 12 Be it known unto the king,—that the Jews who came up from thee unto us are come to Jerusalem,—the rebellious and wicked city are they building, and the walls have they finished, and the foundations will they repair.

content: 13 Now be it known to the king, that if this city be built, and the walls thereof be finished neither tribute､ excise､ nor toll will they render, and so the revenue of the kings shalt thou damage.
content_old: 13 Now be it known to the king, that if this city be built, and the walls thereof be finished neither tribute､ excise､ nor toll will they render, and so the revenue of the kings shalt thou damage.

content: 14 Now because the salt of the palace we have eaten the impoverishment of the king it is not meet for us to see,—therefore have we sent､ and certified the king;
content_old: 14 Now because the salt of the palace we have eaten the impoverishment of the king it is not meet for us to see,—therefore have we sent､ and certified the king;

content: 15 so that search may be made in the book of the records of thy fathers､ so shalt thou find out in the book of records—and shalt ascertain, that this city is a rebellious city､ and one that causeth damage unto kings and provinces, and that rebeIlion have they been wont to cause in the midst thereof since the days of age-past time,—for this cause was this city laid waste.
content_old: 15 so that search may be made in the book of the records of thy fathers､ so shalt thou find out in the book of records—and shalt ascertain, that this city is a rebellious city､ and one that causeth damage unto kings and provinces, and that rebeIlion have they been wont to cause in the midst thereof since the days of age-past time,—for this cause was this city laid waste.

content: 16 We do certify the king that if this city be built, and the walls thereof finished for that very reason portion Beyond the River shalt thou have none.
content_old: 16 We do certify the king that if this city be built, and the walls thereof finished for that very reason portion Beyond the River shalt thou have none.

content: 17 The king sent a message unto Rehum holder of judicial authority､ and Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their associates､ who were dwelling in Samaria, and the rest Beyond the River､ Peace､ and so forth.
content_old: 17 The king sent a message unto Rehum holder of judicial authority､ and Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their associates､ who were dwelling in Samaria, and the rest Beyond the River､ Peace､ and so forth.

content: 18 The letter which ye sent unto us was distinctly read before me;
content_old: 18 The letter which ye sent unto us was distinctly read before me;

content: 19 And from me went forth an edict, and they have made search and found､ that this city since the days of age-past time against kings hath lifted herself up,—and sedition and rebellion have been made therein;
content_old: 19 And from me went forth an edict, and they have made search and found､ that this city since the days of age-past time against kings hath lifted herself up,—and sedition and rebellion have been made therein;

content: 20 and mighty kings have there been over Jerusalem, and bearing rule everywhere Beyond the River,—and tribute､ excise､ and toll have been given to them.
content_old: 20 and mighty kings have there been over Jerusalem, and bearing rule everywhere Beyond the River,—and tribute､ excise､ and toll have been given to them.

content: 21 Now issue ye an edict, to forbid these men,—that this city be not built, until from me the edict be issued.
content_old: 21 Now issue ye an edict, to forbid these men,—that this city be not built, until from me the edict be issued.

content: 22 Beware､ then､ of failure to do thus,—wherefore should the damage increase, to inflict loss on the kings?
content_old: 22 Beware､ then､ of failure to do thus,—wherefore should the damage increase, to inflict loss on the kings?

content: 23 Then when the copy of the letter of Artaxerxes the king had been read before Rehum､ and Shimshai the scribe､ and their associates they journeyed in haste to Jerusalem､ unto the Jews, and forbade them､ with arm and force.
content_old: 23 Then when the copy of the letter of Artaxerxes the king had been read before Rehum､ and Shimshai the scribe､ and their associates they journeyed in haste to Jerusalem､ unto the Jews, and forbade them､ with arm and force.

content: 1 Then were moved to prophesy､ Haggai the prophet､ and Zechariah son of Iddo､ the prophets, unto the Jews who were in Judæa and in Jerusalem,—in the name of the God of Israel､ unto them.
content_old: 1 Then were moved to prophesy､ Haggai the prophet､ and Zechariah son of Iddo､ the prophets, unto the Jews who were in Judæa and in Jerusalem,—in the name of the God of Israel､ unto them.

content: 2 Then arose—Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel､ and Jeshua son of Jozadak, and began to build the house of God､ which was in Jerusalem,—and with them were the prophets of God､ strengthening them.
content_old: 2 Then arose—Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel､ and Jeshua son of Jozadak, and began to build the house of God､ which was in Jerusalem,—and with them were the prophets of God､ strengthening them.

content: 3 At that time came unto them Tattenai pasha Beyond the River､ and Shethar-bozenai､ and their associates,—and thus spake they unto them, Who hath issued unto you an edict､ this house to build, and this wall to complete?
content_old: 3 At that time came unto them Tattenai pasha Beyond the River､ and Shethar-bozenai､ and their associates,—and thus spake they unto them, Who hath issued unto you an edict､ this house to build, and this wall to complete?

content: 4 Then after this manner spake we unto them,— What are the names of these men, who this building do rear?
content_old: 4 Then after this manner spake we unto them,— What are the names of these men, who this building do rear?

content: 5 Nevertheless the eye of their God was upon the elders of Judah, and they did not forbid them, until the matter unto Darius should come,—and then answer be returned by letter､ concerning this.
content_old: 5 Nevertheless the eye of their God was upon the elders of Judah, and they did not forbid them, until the matter unto Darius should come,—and then answer be returned by letter､ concerning this.

content: 6 A copy of the letter which Tattenai pasha Beyond the River､ and Shethar-bozenai､ and his associates, the Apharsachites､ who were Beyond the River､ sent unto Darius the king:
content_old: 6 A copy of the letter which Tattenai pasha Beyond the River､ and Shethar-bozenai､ and his associates, the Apharsachites､ who were Beyond the River､ sent unto Darius the king:

content: 7 a message sent they unto him,—and thus was it written therein, Unto Darius the king all prosperity!
content_old: 7 a message sent they unto him,—and thus was it written therein, Unto Darius the king all prosperity!

content: 8 Be it known unto the king､ that we journeyed into the province of Judah､ unto the house of the Great God, and the same is being built with large stones, and timber is being laid in the walls,—and this work with speed is being done､ and is prospering in their hands.
content_old: 8 Be it known unto the king､ that we journeyed into the province of Judah､ unto the house of the Great God, and the same is being built with large stones, and timber is being laid in the walls,—and this work with speed is being done､ and is prospering in their hands.

content: 9 Then asked we of these elders, thus we said to them,— Who hath issued to you an edict this house to build, and this wall to complete?
content_old: 9 Then asked we of these elders, thus we said to them,— Who hath issued to you an edict this house to build, and this wall to complete?

content: 10 Yea their names also asked we of them､ to certify thee,—that we might write the name､ of the men who are at their head.
content_old: 10 Yea their names also asked we of them､ to certify thee,—that we might write the name､ of the men who are at their head.

content: 11 And thus returned they answer to us､ saying,— We are servants of the God of the heavens and the earth､ and are building the house which was built these many years ago､ which a great king of Israel built and completed.
content_old: 11 And thus returned they answer to us､ saying,— We are servants of the God of the heavens and the earth､ and are building the house which was built these many years ago､ which a great king of Israel built and completed.

content: 12 But after that our fathers had provoked the God of the heavens to wrath he delivered them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon､ the Chaldean,—and this house he destroyed, and. the people he exiled to Babylon.
content_old: 12 But after that our fathers had provoked the God of the heavens to wrath he delivered them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon､ the Chaldean,—and this house he destroyed, and. the people he exiled to Babylon.

content: 13 Howbeit in the first year of Cyrus king of Babylon Cyrus the king issued an edict this house of God to build.
content_old: 13 Howbeit in the first year of Cyrus king of Babylon Cyrus the king issued an edict this house of God to build.

content: 14 Moreover also the utensils of the house of God､ of gold and silver, which Nebuchadnezzar had brought forth out of the temple which was in Jerusalem､ and had brought into the temple of Babylon Cyrus the king brought them forth out of the temple of Babylon, and they were delivered to one Sheshbazzar by name, whom he made pasha;
content_old: 14 Moreover also the utensils of the house of God､ of gold and silver, which Nebuchadnezzar had brought forth out of the temple which was in Jerusalem､ and had brought into the temple of Babylon Cyrus the king brought them forth out of the temple of Babylon, and they were delivered to one Sheshbazzar by name, whom he made pasha;

content: 15 and said to him— These utensils take､ go carry them into the temple that is in Jerusalem,—and let the house of God be built in its place.
content_old: 15 and said to him— These utensils take､ go carry them into the temple that is in Jerusalem,—and let the house of God be built in its place.

content: 16 Then this Sheshbazzar came､ he laid the foundations of the house of God､ which was in Jerusalem,—and since then､ even until now it hath been in building､ and is not finished.
content_old: 16 Then this Sheshbazzar came､ he laid the foundations of the house of God､ which was in Jerusalem,—and since then､ even until now it hath been in building､ and is not finished.

content: 1 Then Darius the king issued an edict,—and they made search in the house of the books､ where the treasures were laid up in Babylon.
content_old: 1 Then Darius the king issued an edict,—and they made search in the house of the books､ where the treasures were laid up in Babylon.

content: 2 And there was found in Achmetha､ in the fortress which is in the province of Media､ a roll,—and thus was it written therein､ as a record:—
content_old: 2 And there was found in Achmetha､ in the fortress which is in the province of Media､ a roll,—and thus was it written therein､ as a record:—

content: 3 In the first year of Cyrus the king Cyrus the king issued an edict, as to the house of God in Jerusalem､ Let the house be built, the place where they used to offer sacrifices, and let the foundations thereof be reared,—the height thereof sixty cubits, the breadth thereof sixty cubits;
content_old: 3 In the first year of Cyrus the king Cyrus the king issued an edict, as to the house of God in Jerusalem､ Let the house be built, the place where they used to offer sacrifices, and let the foundations thereof be reared,—the height thereof sixty cubits, the breadth thereof sixty cubits;

content: 4 layers of large stones､ three, and one layer of new timber,—and as for the expenses out of the house of the king let them be given.
content_old: 4 layers of large stones､ three, and one layer of new timber,—and as for the expenses out of the house of the king let them be given.

content: 5 Moreover also the utensils of the house of God､ of gold and silver, which Nebuchadnezzar took forth out of the temple that was in Jerusalem､ and brought unto Babylon let them again be taken to the temple which is in Jerusalem every one to its place, and lay them up in the house of God.
content_old: 5 Moreover also the utensils of the house of God､ of gold and silver, which Nebuchadnezzar took forth out of the temple that was in Jerusalem､ and brought unto Babylon let them again be taken to the temple which is in Jerusalem every one to its place, and lay them up in the house of God.

content: 6 Now therefore､ Tattenai pasha Beyond the River､ Shethar-bozenai､ and their associates, the Apharsachites､ who are Beyond the River,—be ye far from thence:
content_old: 6 Now therefore､ Tattenai pasha Beyond the River､ Shethar-bozenai､ and their associates, the Apharsachites､ who are Beyond the River,—be ye far from thence:

content: 7 let alone the work of this house of God,—the pasha of Judah､ and the elders of Judah this house of God shall build upon its place;
content_old: 7 let alone the work of this house of God,—the pasha of Judah､ and the elders of Judah this house of God shall build upon its place;

content: 8 And from me is issued an edict, as to that which ye shall do､ with these elders of Judah, for the building of this house of God,— That of the resources of the king, even the tribute Beyond the River forthwith the expenses be given unto these men､ for they must not be hindered.
content_old: 8 And from me is issued an edict, as to that which ye shall do､ with these elders of Judah, for the building of this house of God,— That of the resources of the king, even the tribute Beyond the River forthwith the expenses be given unto these men､ for they must not be hindered.

content: 9 And whatever may be the need—whether young bullocks or rams or lambs for ascending-sacrifices unto the God of the heavens､ wheat､ salt､ wine or oil､ according to the command of the priests who are in Jerusalem—that it be given to them､ day by day､ without fail;
content_old: 9 And whatever may be the need—whether young bullocks or rams or lambs for ascending-sacrifices unto the God of the heavens､ wheat､ salt､ wine or oil､ according to the command of the priests who are in Jerusalem—that it be given to them､ day by day､ without fail;

content: 10 that they may be offering sweet-smelling sacrifices unto the God of the heavens,—and be praying for the life of the king､ and his sons.
content_old: 10 that they may be offering sweet-smelling sacrifices unto the God of the heavens,—and be praying for the life of the king､ and his sons.

content: 11 And from me is issued an edict, that any man who shall alter this message let timber be torn out of his house, and being lifted up let him be fastened thereunto,—and his house a dunghill be made for this;
content_old: 11 And from me is issued an edict, that any man who shall alter this message let timber be torn out of his house, and being lifted up let him be fastened thereunto,—and his house a dunghill be made for this;

content: 12 and the God who hath caused his Name to dwell there destroy any king or people､ who shall put forth their hand to alter to destroy this house of God､ which is in Jerusalem. I､ Darius have issued an edict, forthwith let it be done.
content_old: 12 and the God who hath caused his Name to dwell there destroy any king or people､ who shall put forth their hand to alter to destroy this house of God､ which is in Jerusalem. I､ Darius have issued an edict, forthwith let it be done.

content: 13 Then Tattenai the pasha Beyond the River､ Shethar-bozenai､ and their associates,—according as Darius the king had sent so､ forthwith they did.
content_old: 13 Then Tattenai the pasha Beyond the River､ Shethar-bozenai､ and their associates,—according as Darius the king had sent so､ forthwith they did.

content: 14 And the elders of the Jews went on building and prospering, through the prophesying of Haggai the prophet､ and Zechariah son of Iddo,—they both built and finished､ owing to the edict of the God of Israel, and owing to the edict of Cyrus and Darius､ and Artaxerxes king of Persia.
content_old: 14 And the elders of the Jews went on building and prospering, through the prophesying of Haggai the prophet､ and Zechariah son of Iddo,—they both built and finished､ owing to the edict of the God of Israel, and owing to the edict of Cyrus and Darius､ and Artaxerxes king of Persia.

content: 15 And this house was finished, by the third day of the month Adar,—the which was the sixth year of the reign of Darius the king.
content_old: 15 And this house was finished, by the third day of the month Adar,—the which was the sixth year of the reign of Darius the king.

content: 16 Then did the sons of Israel､ the priests and the Levites､ and the rest of the Sons of the Exile､ keep the dedication of this house of God､ with joy;
content_old: 16 Then did the sons of Israel､ the priests and the Levites､ and the rest of the Sons of the Exile､ keep the dedication of this house of God､ with joy;

content: 17 and offered､ for the dedication of this house of God, bullocks one hundred､ rams two hundred､ lambs four hundred,—and he-goats､ as a sin-offering for all Israel twelve, according to the number of the tribes of Israel.
content_old: 17 and offered､ for the dedication of this house of God, bullocks one hundred､ rams two hundred､ lambs four hundred,—and he-goats､ as a sin-offering for all Israel twelve, according to the number of the tribes of Israel.

content: 18 And they set up the priests in their divisions､ and the Levites in their courses, over the service of God､ which was in Jerusalem,—as it is written､ in the Book of Moses.
content_old: 18 And they set up the priests in their divisions､ and the Levites in their courses, over the service of God､ which was in Jerusalem,—as it is written､ in the Book of Moses.

content: 19 And the Sons of the Exile kept the passover,—on the fourteenth of the first month;
content_old: 19 And the Sons of the Exile kept the passover,—on the fourteenth of the first month;

content: 20 for the priests and the Levites had purified themselves as one man､ all of them were pure,—so they slaughtered the passover for all the Sons of the Exile, and for their brethren the priests､ and for themselves.
content_old: 20 for the priests and the Levites had purified themselves as one man､ all of them were pure,—so they slaughtered the passover for all the Sons of the Exile, and for their brethren the priests､ and for themselves.

content: 21 Therefore the sons of Israel who had returned from the Exile and all who had separated themselves from the impurity of the nations of the land unto them､ did eat,—to seek Yahweh､ God of Israel;
content_old: 21 Therefore the sons of Israel who had returned from the Exile and all who had separated themselves from the impurity of the nations of the land unto them､ did eat,—to seek Yahweh､ God of Israel;

content: 1 Now after these things, in the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia Ezra— son of Seraiah, son of Azariah, son of Hilkiah;

content: 6 this Ezra came up out of Babylon, he being a ready scribe in the law of Moses, which Yahweh God of Israel had given,—and the king gave him､ according to the hand of Yahweh his God upon him, all his request.
content_old: 6 this Ezra came up out of Babylon, he being a ready scribe in the law of Moses, which Yahweh God of Israel had given,—and the king gave him､ according to the hand of Yahweh his God upon him, all his request.

content: 7 So then there came up some of the sons of Israel､ and some of the priests and the Levites and the singers and the doorkeepers and the Nethinim､ unto Jerusalem,—in the seventh year of Artaxerxes the king.
content_old: 7 So then there came up some of the sons of Israel､ and some of the priests and the Levites and the singers and the doorkeepers and the Nethinim､ unto Jerusalem,—in the seventh year of Artaxerxes the king.

content: 8 And he entered Jerusalem､ in the fifth month,—the same was the seventh year of the king.
content_old: 8 And he entered Jerusalem､ in the fifth month,—the same was the seventh year of the king.

content: 9 For on the first of the first month was a beginning made of coming up from Babylon,—and on the first of the fifth month entered he into Jerusalem, according to the good hand of his God upon him.
content_old: 9 For on the first of the first month was a beginning made of coming up from Babylon,—and on the first of the fifth month entered he into Jerusalem, according to the good hand of his God upon him.

content: 10 For Ezra had settled his heart, to study the law of Yahweh､ and to do it,—and to teach in Israel､ statute and regulation.
content_old: 10 For Ezra had settled his heart, to study the law of Yahweh､ and to do it,—and to teach in Israel､ statute and regulation.

content: 11 Now this is a copy of the letter which King Artaxerxes gave､ to Ezra the priest the scribe,—the scribe of the words of the commandments of Yahweh､ and of his statutes､ for Israel:—

content: 12 Artaxerxes, king of kings Unto Ezra the priest､ scribe of the law of the God of the heavens—To despatch and so forth.
content_old: 12 Artaxerxes, king of kings Unto Ezra the priest､ scribe of the law of the God of the heavens—To despatch and so forth.

content: 13 From me is issued an edict, that every one in my kingdom､ of the people of Israel､ and of their priests and the Levites､ who is minded of his own freewill to go to Jerusalem with thee let him go.
content_old: 13 From me is issued an edict, that every one in my kingdom､ of the people of Israel､ and of their priests and the Levites､ who is minded of his own freewill to go to Jerusalem with thee let him go.

content: 14 Forasmuch as from before the king and his seven counsellors thou art sent, to enquire concerning Judah and as to Jerusalem,—by the law of thy God which is in thy hand;
content_old: 14 Forasmuch as from before the king and his seven counsellors thou art sent, to enquire concerning Judah and as to Jerusalem,—by the law of thy God which is in thy hand;

content: 15 and to carry the silver and gold which the king and his counsellors have freely offered unto the God of Israel, who in Jerusalem hath his habitation;
content_old: 15 and to carry the silver and gold which the king and his counsellors have freely offered unto the God of Israel, who in Jerusalem hath his habitation;

content: 16 and all the silver and the gold, which thou shalt find､ in all the province of Babylon,—with the freewill offering of the people and of the priests offered willingly for the house of their God which is in Jerusalem
content_old: 16 and all the silver and the gold, which thou shalt find､ in all the province of Babylon,—with the freewill offering of the people and of the priests offered willingly for the house of their God which is in Jerusalem

content: 17 therefore with all diligence shalt thou buy—with this silver—bullocks､ rams､ lambs, with their meal-offerings､ and their drink-offerings,—and shalt offer them upon the altar of the house of your God which is in Jerusalem;
content_old: 17 therefore with all diligence shalt thou buy—with this silver—bullocks､ rams､ lambs, with their meal-offerings､ and their drink-offerings,—and shalt offer them upon the altar of the house of your God which is in Jerusalem;

content: 18 and whatsoever unto thee and unto thy brethren shall seem good with the rest of the silver and the gold to do according to the pleasure of your God shall ye do.
content_old: 18 and whatsoever unto thee and unto thy brethren shall seem good with the rest of the silver and the gold to do according to the pleasure of your God shall ye do.

content: 19 And the utensils which are freely given to thee for the service of the house of thy God put thou back､ before the God of Jerusalem.
content_old: 19 And the utensils which are freely given to thee for the service of the house of thy God put thou back､ before the God of Jerusalem.

content: 20 And the rest of the need of the house of thy God, which it shall fall to thee to give thou shalt give､ out of the treasure-house of the king.
content_old: 20 And the rest of the need of the house of thy God, which it shall fall to thee to give thou shalt give､ out of the treasure-house of the king.

content: 21 And from me myself､ Artaxerxes the king issueth an edict, to all the treasurers who are Beyond the River,—that whatsoever Ezra the priest the scribe of the law of the God of the heavens shall ask of you with diligence shall it be done:
content_old: 21 And from me myself､ Artaxerxes the king issueth an edict, to all the treasurers who are Beyond the River,—that whatsoever Ezra the priest the scribe of the law of the God of the heavens shall ask of you with diligence shall it be done:

content: 22 unto a hundred talents of silver, and unto a hundred measures of wheat, and unto a hundred baths of wine, and unto a hundred baths of oil,—and salt without limit.
content_old: 22 unto a hundred talents of silver, and unto a hundred measures of wheat, and unto a hundred baths of wine, and unto a hundred baths of oil,—and salt without limit.

content: 23 Whatsoever is due to an edict of the God of the heavens let it be done diligently､ for the house of the God of the heavens,—for wherefore should there be wrath against the realm of the king and his sons?
content_old: 23 Whatsoever is due to an edict of the God of the heavens let it be done diligently､ for the house of the God of the heavens,—for wherefore should there be wrath against the realm of the king and his sons?

content: 24 And you we do certify､ that as touching any of the priests or the Levites､ the singers､ the doorkeepers､ the Nethinim, or the servitors of this house of God tribute､ excise or toll shall it not be competent to impose upon them.
content_old: 24 And you we do certify､ that as touching any of the priests or the Levites､ the singers､ the doorkeepers､ the Nethinim, or the servitors of this house of God tribute､ excise or toll shall it not be competent to impose upon them.

content: 25 And thou､ Ezra according to the wisdom of thy God that is in thy hand appoint thou judges and magistrates､ who shall administer justice to all the people that are Beyond the River, to all who know the law of thy God,—and whoso knoweth not ye shall teach.
content_old: 25 And thou､ Ezra according to the wisdom of thy God that is in thy hand appoint thou judges and magistrates､ who shall administer justice to all the people that are Beyond the River, to all who know the law of thy God,—and whoso knoweth not ye shall teach.

content: 26 But whosoever shall not do the law of thy God and the law of the king speedily let penalty be exacted from him,—whether to death､ or to banishment, or to confiscation of goods､ or to imprisonment.
content_old: 26 But whosoever shall not do the law of thy God and the law of the king speedily let penalty be exacted from him,—whether to death､ or to banishment, or to confiscation of goods､ or to imprisonment.

content: 27 Blessed be Yahweh､ God of our fathers,—who hath put the like of this into the heart of the king, to beautify the house of Yahweh､ which is in Jerusalem;

content: 15 And I gathered them together､ unto the river that cometh into Ahava, and we encamped there three days,—and I informed myself among the people and the priests, and of the sons of Levi found I none there.
content_old: 15 And I gathered them together､ unto the river that cometh into Ahava, and we encamped there three days,—and I informed myself among the people and the priests, and of the sons of Levi found I none there.

content: 16 So I sent for Eliezer､ for Ariel､ for Shemaiah､ and for Elnathan､ and for Jarib､ and for Elnathan､ and for Nathan､ and for Zechariah､ and for Meshullam､ chief men,—also for Joiarib and for Elnathan､ teachers.
content_old: 16 So I sent for Eliezer､ for Ariel､ for Shemaiah､ and for Elnathan､ and for Jarib､ and for Elnathan､ and for Nathan､ and for Zechariah､ and for Meshullam､ chief men,—also for Joiarib and for Elnathan､ teachers.

content: 17 And I sent them forth unto Iddo the chief, at the place Casiphia,—and I put into their mouth words､ to speak unto Iddo and his brethren the Nethinim､ at the place Casiphia, to bring unto us attendants for the house of our God.
content_old: 17 And I sent them forth unto Iddo the chief, at the place Casiphia,—and I put into their mouth words､ to speak unto Iddo and his brethren the Nethinim､ at the place Casiphia, to bring unto us attendants for the house of our God.

content: 18 So they brought unto us､ according to the good hand of our God upon us､ a man of discretion, of the sons of Mahli､ son of Levi､ son of Israel,—and Sherebiah､ and his sons and his brethren､ eighteen;
content_old: 18 So they brought unto us､ according to the good hand of our God upon us､ a man of discretion, of the sons of Mahli､ son of Levi､ son of Israel,—and Sherebiah､ and his sons and his brethren､ eighteen;

content: 19 and Hashabiah, and with him Jeshaiah､ of the sons of Merari,—his brethren and their sons､ twenty;
content_old: 19 and Hashabiah, and with him Jeshaiah､ of the sons of Merari,—his brethren and their sons､ twenty;

content: 20 and of the Nethinim whom David and the rulers had given for the service of the Levites Nethinim two hundred and twenty,—all of them expressed by name.
content_old: 20 and of the Nethinim whom David and the rulers had given for the service of the Levites Nethinim two hundred and twenty,—all of them expressed by name.

content: 21 Then proclaimed I there a fast､ by the river Ahava, that we might humble ourselves before our God,—to seek of him a smooth way, for us and for our little ones､ and for all our substance.
content_old: 21 Then proclaimed I there a fast､ by the river Ahava, that we might humble ourselves before our God,—to seek of him a smooth way, for us and for our little ones､ and for all our substance.

content: 22 For I was ashamed to ask of the king､ a band of soldiers and horsemen, to help us against the enemy in the way, because we had spoken unto the king､ saying､ The hand of our God is upon all who seek him､ for good, But his power and his anger are against all who forsake him.
content_old: 22 For I was ashamed to ask of the king､ a band of soldiers and horsemen, to help us against the enemy in the way, because we had spoken unto the king､ saying､ The hand of our God is upon all who seek him､ for good, But his power and his anger are against all who forsake him.

content: 23 So we fasted and sought of our God､ concerning this,—and he suffered himself to be entreated by us.
content_old: 23 So we fasted and sought of our God､ concerning this,—and he suffered himself to be entreated by us.

content: 24 Then I separated､ from among the rulers of the priests､ twelve,—even Sherebiah､ Hashabiah, and with them､ from among their brethren ten;
content_old: 24 Then I separated､ from among the rulers of the priests､ twelve,—even Sherebiah､ Hashabiah, and with them､ from among their brethren ten;

content: 25 and weighed unto them, the silver and the gold､ and the utensils,—the heave-offering for the house of our God､ which the king and his counsellors and his rulers and all Israel who were present､ had offered:
content_old: 25 and weighed unto them, the silver and the gold､ and the utensils,—the heave-offering for the house of our God､ which the king and his counsellors and his rulers and all Israel who were present､ had offered:

content: 26 I even weighed unto their hand､ of silver six hundred and fifty talents, and of utensils of silver a hundred talents,—of gold a hundred talents;
content_old: 26 I even weighed unto their hand､ of silver six hundred and fifty talents, and of utensils of silver a hundred talents,—of gold a hundred talents;

content: 27 and bowls of gold twenty, of a thousand drams,—and utensils of fine bright bronze two, precious as gold.
content_old: 27 and bowls of gold twenty, of a thousand drams,—and utensils of fine bright bronze two, precious as gold.

content: 28 Then said I unto them､ Ye are hallowed unto Yahweh, and the utensils are hallowed,—and the silver and the gold are a freewill offering, unto Yahweh､ God of your fathers:
content_old: 28 Then said I unto them､ Ye are hallowed unto Yahweh, and the utensils are hallowed,—and the silver and the gold are a freewill offering, unto Yahweh､ God of your fathers:

content: 29 Watch and guard､ until ye weigh them before the rulers of the priests and the Levites and the ancestral rulers of Israel､ in Jerusalem,—in the chambers of the house of Yahweh.
content_old: 29 Watch and guard､ until ye weigh them before the rulers of the priests and the Levites and the ancestral rulers of Israel､ in Jerusalem,—in the chambers of the house of Yahweh.

content: 30 So the priests and the Levites accepted the weight of the silver and the gold､ and the utensils,—to bring to Jerusalem､ unto the house of our God.
content_old: 30 So the priests and the Levites accepted the weight of the silver and the gold､ and the utensils,—to bring to Jerusalem､ unto the house of our God.

content: 31 Then brake we up from the river of Ahava､ on the twelfth of the first month, to journey unto Jerusalem,—and the hand of our God was upon us, and he delivered us from the grasp of the enemy and of the lier in wait､ by the way.
content_old: 31 Then brake we up from the river of Ahava､ on the twelfth of the first month, to journey unto Jerusalem,—and the hand of our God was upon us, and he delivered us from the grasp of the enemy and of the lier in wait､ by the way.

content: 32 So we came to Jerusalem,—and we rested there､ three days.
content_old: 32 So we came to Jerusalem,—and we rested there､ three days.

content: 33 And on the fourth day was weighed—the silver and the gold and the utensils､ in the house of our God､ unto the hand of Meremoth son of Uriah､ the priest, and with him was Eleazar son of Phinehas,—and with them were Jozabad son of Jeshua and Noadiah son of Binnui､ Levites:
content_old: 33 And on the fourth day was weighed—the silver and the gold and the utensils､ in the house of our God､ unto the hand of Meremoth son of Uriah､ the priest, and with him was Eleazar son of Phinehas,—and with them were Jozabad son of Jeshua and Noadiah son of Binnui､ Levites:

content: 34 by the number and by the weight of the whole,—and all the weight､ was written down､ at that time.
content_old: 34 by the number and by the weight of the whole,—and all the weight､ was written down､ at that time.

content: 35 They who came in out of the captivity､ Sons of the Exile､ offered as ascending-sacrifices unto the God of Israel—bullocks twelve for all Israel､ rams ninety-six､ young sheep seventy-seven, he-goats for bearing sin､ twelve,—the whole as an ascending-sacrifice unto Yahweh.
content_old: 35 They who came in out of the captivity､ Sons of the Exile､ offered as ascending-sacrifices unto the God of Israel—bullocks twelve for all Israel､ rams ninety-six､ young sheep seventy-seven, he-goats for bearing sin､ twelve,—the whole as an ascending-sacrifice unto Yahweh.

content: 1 Now when these things were ended the rulers drew near unto me､ saying､ The people of Israel and the priests and the Levites have not kept themselves separate from the peoples of the lands,—in view of their abominations—even of the Canaanites､ the Hittites､ the Perizzites､ the Jebusites､ the Ammonites､ the Moabites, the Egyptians､ and the Amorites;
content_old: 1 Now when these things were ended the rulers drew near unto me､ saying､ The people of Israel and the priests and the Levites have not kept themselves separate from the peoples of the lands,—in view of their abominations—even of the Canaanites､ the Hittites､ the Perizzites､ the Jebusites､ the Ammonites､ the Moabites, the Egyptians､ and the Amorites;

content: 2 for they have taken of their daughters､ for themselves and for their sons, so that the holy seed have intermingled themselves among the peoples of the lands,—and the hand of the rulers and the deputies hath､ in this unfaithfulness､ been foremost.
content_old: 2 for they have taken of their daughters､ for themselves and for their sons, so that the holy seed have intermingled themselves among the peoples of the lands,—and the hand of the rulers and the deputies hath､ in this unfaithfulness､ been foremost.

content: 3 When I heard this thing I rent my garment､ and my robe,—and tore out of the hair of my head and my beard, and sat stunned.
content_old: 3 When I heard this thing I rent my garment､ and my robe,—and tore out of the hair of my head and my beard, and sat stunned.

content: 4 Then unto me were gathered､ all who trembled at the words of the God of Israel, concerning the unfaithfulness of them who had been exiled,—but I sat stunned, until the evening gift.
content_old: 4 Then unto me were gathered､ all who trembled at the words of the God of Israel, concerning the unfaithfulness of them who had been exiled,—but I sat stunned, until the evening gift.

content: 5 And at the evening gift I arose from mine affliction, which had been accompanied by the rending of my garment and my robe,—and I bowed upon my knees, and spread forth my hands unto Yahweh my God;
content_old: 5 And at the evening gift I arose from mine affliction, which had been accompanied by the rending of my garment and my robe,—and I bowed upon my knees, and spread forth my hands unto Yahweh my God;

content: 6 and said､ O my God､ I turn pale and am ashamed, to lift up､ O my God､ my face unto thee,—for our iniquities have multiplied above the head, and our guilt hath magnified itself unto the heavens.
content_old: 6 and said､ O my God､ I turn pale and am ashamed, to lift up､ O my God､ my face unto thee,—for our iniquities have multiplied above the head, and our guilt hath magnified itself unto the heavens.

content: 7 Since the days of our fathers we have been in great guilt, until this day,—and for our iniquities have we been given up—we､ our kings､ our priests—into the hand of the kings of the lands, by sword and by captivity and by spoiling and by a turning pale of face､ as at this day.
content_old: 7 Since the days of our fathers we have been in great guilt, until this day,—and for our iniquities have we been given up—we､ our kings､ our priests—into the hand of the kings of the lands, by sword and by captivity and by spoiling and by a turning pale of face､ as at this day.

content: 8 And now for a very little moment hath come favour from Yahweh our God､ in leaving to us a remnant to escape, and in giving to us a nail in his holy place,—that our God may enlighten our eyes, and give us a little reviving in our bondage.
content_old: 8 And now for a very little moment hath come favour from Yahweh our God､ in leaving to us a remnant to escape, and in giving to us a nail in his holy place,—that our God may enlighten our eyes, and give us a little reviving in our bondage.

content: 9 For bondmen we are, but in our bondage hath our God not forsaken us,—but extended unto us lovingkindness before the kings of Persia､ to give us a reviving､ to set up on high the house of our God､ to raise up the desolations there of, and to give us a wall in Judah and in Jerusalem.
content_old: 9 For bondmen we are, but in our bondage hath our God not forsaken us,—but extended unto us lovingkindness before the kings of Persia､ to give us a reviving､ to set up on high the house of our God､ to raise up the desolations there of, and to give us a wall in Judah and in Jerusalem.

content: 10 But now what can we say､ O our God､ after this? for we have forsaken thy commandments,
content_old: 10 But now what can we say､ O our God､ after this? for we have forsaken thy commandments,

content: 11 which thou didst command by the hand of thy servants the prophets､ saying, As for the land which ye are entering to possess an impure land it is, with the impurity of the peoples of the lands,—with their abominations､ which have filled it from one end to the other､ with their uncleanness.
content_old: 11 which thou didst command by the hand of thy servants the prophets､ saying, As for the land which ye are entering to possess an impure land it is, with the impurity of the peoples of the lands,—with their abominations､ which have filled it from one end to the other､ with their uncleanness.

content: 12 Now therefore､ your daughters do not ye give to their sons､ and their daughters do not ye take for your sons, neither shall ye seek their prosperity nor their pleasure､ unto times age-abiding,—to the end ye may become strong､ and may eat the good of the land, and may suffer your children to possess it､ unto times age-abiding.
content_old: 12 Now therefore､ your daughters do not ye give to their sons､ and their daughters do not ye take for your sons, neither shall ye seek their prosperity nor their pleasure､ unto times age-abiding,—to the end ye may become strong､ and may eat the good of the land, and may suffer your children to possess it､ unto times age-abiding.

content: 13 And after all that hath come upon us, for our wicked doings､ and for our great guilt— For thou O our God､ hast spared us､ punishing us less than our iniquities deserved, and hast given us a deliverance such as this
content_old: 13 And after all that hath come upon us, for our wicked doings､ and for our great guilt— For thou O our God､ hast spared us､ punishing us less than our iniquities deserved, and hast given us a deliverance such as this

content: 14 should we again break thy commandments and join ourselves by affinity of marriage with the peoples of these abominations—wouldst thou not be angry with us unto a full end, that there should be neither remainder nor deliverance?
content_old: 14 should we again break thy commandments and join ourselves by affinity of marriage with the peoples of these abominations—wouldst thou not be angry with us unto a full end, that there should be neither remainder nor deliverance?

content: 1 Now when Ezra had prayed and when he had made confession, weeping and casting himself down､ before the house of God there gathered unto him out of Israel､ an exceeding large convocation—men and women and children, for the people wept with a very bitter weeping.
content_old: 1 Now when Ezra had prayed and when he had made confession, weeping and casting himself down､ before the house of God there gathered unto him out of Israel､ an exceeding large convocation—men and women and children, for the people wept with a very bitter weeping.

content: 2 Then responded Shecaniah son of Jehiel of the sons of Elam､ and said unto Ezra. We have been unfaithful with our God､ and have married foreign women from among the peoples of the land,—yet now there is hope for Israel concerning this thing.
content_old: 2 Then responded Shecaniah son of Jehiel of the sons of Elam､ and said unto Ezra. We have been unfaithful with our God､ and have married foreign women from among the peoples of the land,—yet now there is hope for Israel concerning this thing.

content: 3 Now therefore､ let us solemnise a covenant unto our God—to put away all the women and such as have been born of them､ in the counsel of my lord, and them who tremble at the commandment of our God,—and according to the law let it be done.
content_old: 3 Now therefore､ let us solemnise a covenant unto our God—to put away all the women and such as have been born of them､ in the counsel of my lord, and them who tremble at the commandment of our God,—and according to the law let it be done.

content: 4 Arise､ for upon thee resteth the thing､ but we are with thee,—be strong､ and act.
content_old: 4 Arise､ for upon thee resteth the thing､ but we are with thee,—be strong､ and act.

content: 5 Then arose Ezra and made the rulers of the priests､ the Levites､ and all Israel､ swear to do according to this word､—and they sware.
content_old: 5 Then arose Ezra and made the rulers of the priests､ the Levites､ and all Israel､ swear to do according to this word､—and they sware.

content: 6 Then arose Ezra from before the house of God, and went into the chamber of Jehohanan son of Eliashib,—and when he came thither bread did he not eat､ and water did he not drink, for he was mourning over the unfaithfulness of them of the Exile.
content_old: 6 Then arose Ezra from before the house of God, and went into the chamber of Jehohanan son of Eliashib,—and when he came thither bread did he not eat､ and water did he not drink, for he was mourning over the unfaithfulness of them of the Exile.

content: 7 Then made they a proclamation throughout Judah and Jerusalem､ unto all the Sons of the Exile, to gather themselves together unto Jerusalem;
content_old: 7 Then made they a proclamation throughout Judah and Jerusalem､ unto all the Sons of the Exile, to gather themselves together unto Jerusalem;

content: 8 and whosoever should not come within three days､ according to the counsel of the rulers and the elders all his goods should be devoted,—and himself be separated from the convocation of them of the Exile.
content_old: 8 and whosoever should not come within three days､ according to the counsel of the rulers and the elders all his goods should be devoted,—and himself be separated from the convocation of them of the Exile.

content: 9 Then were gathered together all the men of Judah and Benjamin unto Jerusalem､ within three days､ the same was the ninth month､ on the twentieth of the month,—and all the people remained in the broadway of the house of God, trembling concerning the the thing､ and because of the heavy rains.
content_old: 9 Then were gathered together all the men of Judah and Benjamin unto Jerusalem､ within three days､ the same was the ninth month､ on the twentieth of the month,—and all the people remained in the broadway of the house of God, trembling concerning the the thing､ and because of the heavy rains.

content: 10 Then arose Ezra the priest､ and said unto them, Ye have acted unfaithfully, and have married foreign women,—to add unto the guilt of Israel.
content_old: 10 Then arose Ezra the priest､ and said unto them, Ye have acted unfaithfully, and have married foreign women,—to add unto the guilt of Israel.

content: 11 Now therefore､ make confession unto Yahweh God of your fathers､ and do his pleasure,—and separate yourselves from the peoples of the land, and from the foreign women.
content_old: 11 Now therefore､ make confession unto Yahweh God of your fathers､ and do his pleasure,—and separate yourselves from the peoples of the land, and from the foreign women.

content: 12 Then responded all the convocation and said､ with a loud voice,— Thus､ according to thy word concerning us must it be done.
content_old: 12 Then responded all the convocation and said､ with a loud voice,— Thus､ according to thy word concerning us must it be done.

content: 13 Nevertheless the people are many､ and the season is that of the heavy rains, and we are not able to stand outside,—and the business is not one for a single day､ nor yet for two, for we have abundantly transgressed､ in this thing.
content_old: 13 Nevertheless the people are many､ and the season is that of the heavy rains, and we are not able to stand outside,—and the business is not one for a single day､ nor yet for two, for we have abundantly transgressed､ in this thing.

content: 14 Let､ we beseech thee､ our rulers take up their station for all the convocation､ and all who､ throughout our cities､ have married foreign women let them come in at times appointed, and with them the elders of every city､ and the judges thereof, until the glow of the anger of our God be turned from us, concerning this matter.
content_old: 14 Let､ we beseech thee､ our rulers take up their station for all the convocation､ and all who､ throughout our cities､ have married foreign women let them come in at times appointed, and with them the elders of every city､ and the judges thereof, until the glow of the anger of our God be turned from us, concerning this matter.

content: 15 Only Jonathan son of Asahel and Jahzeiah son of Tikvah made a stand against this,—and Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite helped them.
content_old: 15 Only Jonathan son of Asahel and Jahzeiah son of Tikvah made a stand against this,—and Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite helped them.

content: 16 But the Sons of the Exile did thus, and Ezra the priest separated to himself certain men—ancestral heads by their ancestral houses､ and all of them by name,—and they took their seats on the first day of the tenth month to search into the matter;
content_old: 16 But the Sons of the Exile did thus, and Ezra the priest separated to himself certain men—ancestral heads by their ancestral houses､ and all of them by name,—and they took their seats on the first day of the tenth month to search into the matter;

content: 17 and they made an end with all the men who had married foreign women,—by the first day of the first month.
content_old: 17 and they made an end with all the men who had married foreign women,—by the first day of the first month.

content: 18 Now there were found of the sons of the priests who had married foreign women,— of the sons of Jeshua son of Jozadak､ and his brethren Maaseiah､ and Eliezer, and Jarib､ and Gedaliah;
content_old: 18 Now there were found of the sons of the priests who had married foreign women,— of the sons of Jeshua son of Jozadak､ and his brethren Maaseiah､ and Eliezer, and Jarib､ and Gedaliah;

content: 19 and they gave their hand､ that they would put away their wives,—and being guilty they offered a ram of the flock for their guilt.
content_old: 19 and they gave their hand､ that they would put away their wives,—and being guilty they offered a ram of the flock for their guilt.

content: 20 And of the sons of Immer Hanani､ and Zebadiah.
content_old: 20 And of the sons of Immer Hanani､ and Zebadiah.

content: 21 And of the sons of Harim Maaseiah and Elijah and Shemaiah, and Jehiel､ and Uzziah.
content_old: 21 And of the sons of Harim Maaseiah and Elijah and Shemaiah, and Jehiel､ and Uzziah.

content: 22 And of the sons of Passhur Elioenai､ Maaseiah､ Ishmael､ Nethanel, Jozabad､ and Elasar.
content_old: 22 And of the sons of Passhur Elioenai､ Maaseiah､ Ishmael､ Nethanel, Jozabad､ and Elasar.

content: 23 And of the Levites Jozabad and Shimei､ and Kelaiah､ the same is Kelita, Pethahiah､ Judah､ and Eliezer.
content_old: 23 And of the Levites Jozabad and Shimei､ and Kelaiah､ the same is Kelita, Pethahiah､ Judah､ and Eliezer.

content: 24 And of the singers Eliashib. And of the doorkeepers Shallum and Telem and Uri.
content_old: 24 And of the singers Eliashib. And of the doorkeepers Shallum and Telem and Uri.

content: 25 And of Israel of the sons of Parosh Ramiah and Izziah and Malchijah and Mijamin and Eleazar, and Malchijah､ and Benaiah.
content_old: 25 And of Israel of the sons of Parosh Ramiah and Izziah and Malchijah and Mijamin and Eleazar, and Malchijah､ and Benaiah.

content: 26 And of the sons of Elam Mattaniah､ Zechariah､ and Jehiel and Abdi, and Jeremoth､ and Elijah.
content_old: 26 And of the sons of Elam Mattaniah､ Zechariah､ and Jehiel and Abdi, and Jeremoth､ and Elijah.

content: 27 And of the sons of Zattu Elioenai､ Eliashib､ Mattaniah and Jeremoth, and Zabad､ and Aziza.
content_old: 27 And of the sons of Zattu Elioenai､ Eliashib､ Mattaniah and Jeremoth, and Zabad､ and Aziza.

content: 28 And of the sons of Bebai Jehohanan､ Hananiah, Zabbai､ Athlai.
content_old: 28 And of the sons of Bebai Jehohanan､ Hananiah, Zabbai､ Athlai.

content: 29 And of the sons of Bani Meshullam､ Malluch､ and Adaiah, Jashub､ and Sheal､ Jeremoth.
content_old: 29 And of the sons of Bani Meshullam､ Malluch､ and Adaiah, Jashub､ and Sheal､ Jeremoth.

content: 30 And of the sons of Pahath-moab Adna and Chelal,—Benaiah､ Maaseiah､ Mattaniah､ Bezalel, and Binnui､ and Manasseh.
content_old: 30 And of the sons of Pahath-moab Adna and Chelal,—Benaiah､ Maaseiah､ Mattaniah､ Bezalel, and Binnui､ and Manasseh.

content: 31 And of the sons of Harim Eliezer､ Isshijah､ Malchijah, Shemaiah､ Shimeon;
content_old: 31 And of the sons of Harim Eliezer､ Isshijah､ Malchijah, Shemaiah､ Shimeon;

content: 32 Benjamin､ Malluch, Shemariah.
content_old: 32 Benjamin､ Malluch, Shemariah.

content: 33 Of the sons of Hashum Mattenai､ Mattattah, Zabad､ Eliphelet,—Jeremai､ Manasseh, Shimei.
content_old: 33 Of the sons of Hashum Mattenai､ Mattattah, Zabad､ Eliphelet,—Jeremai､ Manasseh, Shimei.

content: 34 Of the sons of Bani Maadai､ Amram, and Uel;
content_old: 34 Of the sons of Bani Maadai､ Amram, and Uel;

content: 35 Benaiah､ Bedeiah, Cheluhu;
content_old: 35 Benaiah､ Bedeiah, Cheluhu;

content: 36 Vaniah､ Meremoth, Eliashib;
content_old: 36 Vaniah､ Meremoth, Eliashib;

content: 37 Mettaniah､ Mattenai, and Jaasu;
content_old: 37 Mettaniah､ Mattenai, and Jaasu;

content: 38 and Bani､ and Binnui, Shimei;
content_old: 38 and Bani､ and Binnui, Shimei;

content: 39 and Shelemiah､ and Nathan, and Adaiah;
content_old: 39 and Shelemiah､ and Nathan, and Adaiah;

content: 40 Machnadebai､ Shashai, Sharai;
content_old: 40 Machnadebai､ Shashai, Sharai;

content: 41 Azarel､ and Shelemiah, Shemariah;
content_old: 41 Azarel､ and Shelemiah, Shemariah;

content: 42 Shallum､ Amariah, Joseph.
content_old: 42 Shallum､ Amariah, Joseph.

content: 43 Of the sons of Nebo Jeiel､ Mattithiah, Zabad､ Zebina,—Iddo､ and Joel, Benaiah.
content_old: 43 Of the sons of Nebo Jeiel､ Mattithiah, Zabad､ Zebina,—Iddo､ and Joel, Benaiah.
